Article Title: 'Pets not allowed outside, but inside': Rahul Gandhi reacts to Renuka Chaudhary bringing dog in Parliament; BJP hits back
Article Text:
Leader of Opposition in Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi

‘Is There Any Law?’ Renuka Chaudhary Sparks Row After Bringing Stray Dog to Parliament

NEW DELHI: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday weighed in on the controversy over colleague Renuka Chowdhury bringing a stray dog to Parliament House, saying pets are not allowed outside the complex but “inside”.“Dog is the main topic of today, I believe. What has the poor dog done. The dog had come here. Why is it not allowed?” Gandhi told reporters, as quoted by PTI.Pointing towards the Parliament House building, he said, “Pets are not allowed here but they are allowed inside.”“I guess these are the things that India is discussing these days,” he added.Gandhi’s comments drew criticism from BJP spokesperson Pradeep Bhandari, who said on X, “Rahul Gandhi is comparing his own Congressmen, and Opposition leaders to Dog! This is how Parivarvadi treat temple of democracy.”Congress MP Renuka Chowdhury on Monday brought a stray dog onto the Parliament grounds on the first day of the Winter Session, despite objections from fellow MPs. Defending her action, she reportedly said that the "real dogs are sitting in Parliament" who regularly bite people.Chowdhury later explained that she had found the puppy on her way to Parliament. She said she stopped after witnessing a collision between a scooter and a car, and noticed the puppy by the roadside before deciding to take it with her.
Article Summary: Congress MP Renuka Chowdhury brought a stray dog onto the Parliament grounds on the first day of the Winter Session. She reportedly said that the "real dogs are sitting in Parliament" who regularly bite people. Gandhi: “Pets are not allowed here but they are allowed inside”

Article Title: Bihar: After bagging home department, BJP gets speaker’s post
Article Text:
Bihar CM Nitish Kumar meets newly elected Speaker of Bihar assembly Prem Kumar (ANI photo)

Marking a Political Milestone, Nitish Kumar Sworn In as Bihar CM for the 10th Time

PATNA: BJP’s Prem Kumar, who won the Gaya Town assembly seat for a record ninth time in the recent Bihar elections, was unanimously elected assembly speaker on Tuesday, succeeding his party colleague Nand Kishore Yadav.Kumar, 70, was the only one who had filed a nomination for the post. Slogans of “Bharat Mata Ki Jai” and “Jai Shri Ram” were raised in the House soon after he was declared “unanimously elected” by voice vote.Having bagged the speaker’s post just days after securing the key home portfolio, held by CM Nitish Kumar for nearly 20 years, BJP has further tightened its grip over the NDA govt in Bihar.The speaker’s role has become increasingly crucial in the state, which has witnessed repeated changes in govts over the past eight years owing to unpredictable shifts in political alliances.JDU minister Vijay Kumar Choudhary, however, dismissed the suggestion that the party had been stripped of the speaker’s post. “When did we have the post that we lost it?” Choudhary, said to reporters. JDU held the post from Nov 2005 to Nov 2020, with Choudhary himself serving one term.
Article Summary: BJP’s Prem Kumar, who won the Gaya Town assembly seat for a record ninth time in the recent Bihar elections, was unanimously elected assembly speaker on Tuesday. Kumar, 70, was the only one who had filed a nomination for the post. Slogans of “Bharat Mata Ki Jai” and “Jai Shri Ram” were raised in the House soon after he was declared “unanimously elected” by voice vote.

Article Title: Haryana sports dept gives itself clean chit in deaths of teen basketballers
Article Text: ROHTAK:The families are incensed. Aman’s father, Suresh Kumar, rejected the govt’s compensation of Rs 5 lakh. “We want an FIR against those responsible for my son’s death. It may not be ‘under the sports department’ on paper, but why did the department never intervene on safety? We do not want compensation or clean chits in the name of inquiries,” he said.Strangely, the Rohtak report was prepared by the same district sports officer (DSO), who was suspended after the incident. Hardik died on Nov 25 and DSO Anoop Singh was suspended the very next day. But the report signed by Anoop is dated Nov 26. Does it mean he submitted the report before his suspension? Which would indicate that he wrapped up the investigation into the boy’s death in a matter of hours and gave his department the clean chit.What’s more, the same report was endorsed by sports deputy director Sunita Khatri, who marked it to director-sports, Rohtak division, Panchkula, on Nov 27, while was (and is) still under suspension.
Article Summary: The Rohtak report was prepared by the same district sports officer (DSO), who was suspended after the incident. The report signed by Anoop Singh is dated Nov 26. Does it mean he submitted the report before his suspension? Which would indicate that he wrapped up the investigation into the boy’s death in a matter of hours and gave his department the clean chit.

Article Title: Chilling mystery on Delhi-Lucknow NH: Child’s body with eye gouged out found with pillow, blanket, snacks in steel box
Article Text: MEERUT: A chilling discovery of a steel box with a child's body stuffed inside along with snack packets has sent shockwaves in Bareilly's Izzatnagar area. The box with the unidentified boy, 8-9 years old, was found near Nakatiya river on Delhi-Lucknow National Highway in Bareilly.SP city, Bareilly, Manush Parekh, said, "The body has been sent for postmortem. Prima facie, he was brutally murdered about 7-8 hours ago. His left eye was gouged out with a sharp-edged tool. Along with the child, the box contained snacks, biscuits, a tiny pillow and a blanket -- all carefully placed inside. Forensic teams have collected crucial evidence."Bareilly SSP Anurag Arya has set up four teams to crack the case. Police are currently scanning CCTV footage from surrounding areas and cross-referencing the findings with missing children reports filed in the district and nearby regions to establish the boy's identity."The site of the dump is a secluded one, and it seems the box was thrown on the highway which connects Delhi with Lucknow. The perpetrators perhaps found it a safe dumping site," added Parekh.Izzatnagar SHO Bijendra Singh said investigation is ongoing and they're exploring all possible angles. It could be a case of kidnapping, murder or even for occult practices. The SHO added: "The postmortem findings might reveal the exact cause of the death."
Article Summary: The box with the unidentified boy, 8-9 years old, was found near Nakatiya river on Delhi-Lucknow National Highway in Bareilly. His left eye was gouged out with a sharp-edged tool. Along with the child, the box contained snacks, biscuits, a tiny pillow and a blanket.

Article Title: Major explosives haul: Rajasthan Police seize pickup truck carrying detonators and gelatin sticks; 2 arrested
Article Text: JAIPUR: Police in Rajsamand district arrested two men after seizing a pickup truck allegedly carrying a large quantity of detonators and gelatin sticks without proper documents, officials said on Tuesday.The seizure was made by a team from Srinathji police station while patrolling near Nathdwara, said deputy superintendent of police Shipra Rajawat,according to news agency PTI.“The officers stopped a pickup without number plates coming from Amet town,” Rajawat said. “On inspection, it was found loaded with detonators, gelatin sticks, and other explosive materials. The driver and his companion could not produce the mandatory documents required for transporting explosives.”The two men, identified as Bhagwat Singh and Himmat Singh, were taken into custody and later arrested under relevant sections of the Explosives Act, she added.Preliminary investigations suggest that the explosives were intended for mining work. However, police have launched a wider inquiry into the source of the consignment, its intended destination, and how it was being transported without clearance.The pickup truck and the explosives have been seized, and further questioning of the accused is ongoing.
Article Summary: Police in Rajsamand district arrested two men after seizing a pickup truck allegedly carrying a large quantity of detonators and gelatin sticks. The seizure was made by a team from Srinathji police station while patrolling near Nathdwara. Preliminary investigations suggest the explosives were intended for mining work.
